Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a pale-red pottery wine-jar, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip, with remains of one line of black-painted hieratic text specifying contents as doubly good [wine] of the western river, year-date lost.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (389878) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/389878)
